intro: Peucedanum quelpaertiense, commonly known as Korean cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
